intro: Piqueria glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular piqueria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often covered in glandular hairs, which secrete substances that may have medicinal or deterrent properties. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
